snippet: The automaker is recalling Buick Enclave, Chevrolet Traverse and GMC Acadia sport utility vehicles of the 2014 model year because of faulty fuel gauge software, federal regulators said Saturday.
abstract: National Highway Traffic Safety Administration reports that General Motors is recalling Buick Enclave, Chevrolet Traverse and GMC Acadia sport utility vehicles of the 2014 model year because of faulty fuel gauge software.
lead_paragraph: The automaker is recalling Buick Enclave, Chevrolet Traverse and GMC Acadia sport utility vehicles of the 2014 model year because of faulty fuel gauge software, federal regulators said Saturday.

headline.main: General Motors Is Recalling 51,000 Cars to Fix Fuel Gauge
headline.print_headline: General Motors Is Recalling 51,000 Cars to Fix Fuel Gauge
